intro: Tithymalus roemerianus, commonly known as the Roemer's tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces oval, dark green leaves that are typically aromatic. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
